New Records: Buddy Hield broke his own record for most made threes in the first five games with a new team in NBA history
Key Match Events: Buddy Hield hit a 26-foot buzzer beat to close the first half
Draymond Green scored eight straight points for the Warriors in the second frame
The Warriors took the lead right out of the gate, scoring the first six points of the night and never looked back
Pre-Game Insights: Lindy Waters III got his first career start as a Warrior
Post-Match Reflections: Brandin Podziemski talked about the win in the post-game interview
Buddy Hield talked about the win in the post-game interview
Trayce Jackson-Davis talked about the win in the post-game interview
Steve Kerr talked about the win in the post-game interview
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors closed out their three-game homestand and will open up a five-game road trip on Saturday night against the Houston Rockets
Buddy Hield finished the game with a team-high 21 points
Brandin Podziemski finished with a near triple-double, recording 13 points, eight rebounds and seven assists
Others: Draymond Green recorded five blocks on the night, his most in a game since Oct. 28, 2021
